alert.note: Alert for Cook (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 1:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, Cook and Lake. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Elevated river and stream flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 141 PM CDT Sunday, gauge reports indicated elevated stream flows due to snow melt. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch are expected over the area through Monday afternoon. Visitors exploring area rivers for waterfall viewing or water recreation should use caution along waterways. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Tettegouche State Park, Little Marais, George Crosby Manitou State Park, Temperance River State Park, Lutsen, Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Finland, Cascade River State Park, Grand Marais, Judge C.R. Magney State Park, and Grand Portage. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children and pets close and under control. Strong river currents can sweep children away. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Hikers should avoid flooded trail crossings.
